items.title: Traditional therapies for improving livestock health
items.summary:
- Three traditional health practices—ectoparasite management, galactogogue properties for milk yield, and prevention/treatment of retained placentation—are being incubated to strengthen livestock health.
- NIF validates, standardizes dosage, and integrates these remedies into the formal veterinary system as *herbal*, eco-friendly therapies.
- A technology license with Rakesh Health Care India Pvt. Ltd. enabled commercialization of three herbal products with demonstrated dosage, efficacy, and safety.

items.title: Century-long Kodaikanal data reveals clues to Sun future
items.summary: - Researchers reconstruct the Sun’s past polar magnetic behavior from over a century of KoSO Ca II K images, revealing how historical data unlocks solar magnetism via the *polar field*.\n- They identify the *polar network* as a powerful proxy for the polar field strength and use it to estimate the ongoing **Solar Cycle 25**, with KoSO's archive feeding modern **AI/ML** analyses.\n- The full dataset, including the reconstructed polar field and the *Polar Network Index (PNI)*, is publicly available on GitHub and Zenodo, enabling researchers worldwide to advance *space weather forecasting*.

India's first indigenous high-precision diode laser
items.summary:
- *Prenishq* Pvt Ltd, IIT Delhi spin-off, unveiled India’s first indigenous high‑precision diode laser for quantum encrypted communication and computing. 
- The laser spans ultraviolet to near‑infrared, with integrated driver electronics and plug‑and‑play outputs for quantum research and quantum‑safe banking. 
- Launched at ESTIC 2025 under NQM/DST support, its compact, low‑maintenance design reinforces India’s lead in indigenous quantum instrumentation.

items.title: Link between Li-rich giants and helium enrichment
items.summary:
- A new study links *lithium-rich red giants* to *helium enhancement*, inferred from MgH and Mg I lines and stellar atmosphere models.
- Using spectra from the Himalayan Chandra Telescope and archives, researchers show that higher He/H correlates with lithium abundance across the sample.
- They find that *helium-enriched giants* are predominantly *super-lithium rich*, suggesting helium enrichment accompanies lithium in red giants.

items.title: QDM unveiled at ESTIC; boosts neuroscience & materials
items.summary:
- Under India's National Quantum Mission, the *Quantum Diamond Microscope (QDM)* from IIT Bombay's PQuest Group enables nanoscale 3D magnetic-field imaging and has secured a patent.
- Announced at ESTIC 2025, it promises applications in *neuroscience*, *materials research*, and direct 3D mapping of buried current paths in chips.
- Built on nitrogen-vacancy (NV) centers in diamond, QDM uses ODMR readout for high-sensitivity magnetic imaging and could transform chip diagnostics and non-destructive testing.

items.author: Dr. Jitendra Singh
items.summary:
- *Dr. Jitendra Singh* hailed the *₹1 Lakh Crore RDI Fund Scheme* as a transformative milestone and catalyst for innovation-led growth in India.
- He spoke at ESTIC 2025, praising government focus on science and proposing structured interfaces between *startups* and *investors*, plus virtual poster-workshops to enhance learning.
- The conclave emphasized cross-ministry collaboration to advance the *ANRF*, align with *Viksit Bharat 2047*, and engage *VAIBHAV Fellows* to contribute to the nation.

DST Special Campaign 5.0: Swachhata & Pendency
items.summary:
- The DST's Special Campaign 5.0 ran from 2–31 October 2025 to reinforce *Swachhata*, reduce *pendency*, and improve governance efficiency across HQs, Autonomous Bodies and Subordinate Offices.
- It identified 318 sites, reviewed 6,600+ physical files and 1,046 e-files, reclaimed 2.10 lakh sq ft, and disposal revenue > ₹6.82 lakhs via e-waste disposal; progress tracked on the *SCPDM portal*.
- The initiative inspired staff through activities like *Rangoli*, *Walkathon*, and regular updates, building a culture of cleanliness, responsibility, and service excellence.

items.title: DST Special Campaign 5.0: Swachhata & Pendency Reduction
items.summary:
- During mid-campaign (2-17 Oct 2025), *433 cleanliness sites* were completed (over the *318 target*), and *115,582 sq ft* of office space were freed, with *12,160 physical files* and *1,132 e-files* reviewed, and *5,133 physical files* weeded with *740 e-files* closed. 
- *63 Public Grievances* cleared (out of 90), *4 of 7 Public Grievance Appeals* disposed, and *3 VIP references* replied. 
- In the implementation phase, DST continues social media advocacy under **#SpecialCampaign5.0**, with revenue of *Rs 1,75,204* and ongoing file reviews.

Morning Coffees Reveal Dyes in Food
items.summary:
- The *coffee-ring effect* concentrates nanoparticles at the droplet edge to create edge hotspots that boost detection signals with **SERS**.
- Gold nanorods form dense edge rings, allowing **Rhodamine B** to be detected down to parts-per-trillion (ppt) levels, thanks to intense hotspot signals.
- The method is simple and cost-effective, with potential for widespread toxin detection in foods and the environment, including possible handheld Raman devices.

items.title: ANRF approves RDI Fund operationalization
items.summary:
- The ANRF Executive Council approved the establishment of a *Special Purpose Fund (SPF)* for the *RDI* scheme, plus the Implementation Guidelines and governance framework.
- It also approved *Special Financial Rules* and the *Management Team Position and Compensation*, as prepared by *DST* with concurrence from *DEA* and *DoE*.
- The *RDI Fund* will operate via a two-tier model: SPF within *ANRF* custodian of the ₹1 lakh crore corpus, channeling to second-level fund managers (**AIFs**, **DFIs**, **NBFCs**) with arm's-length investment committees.

items.title: DST Completes Preparatory Phase for Special Campaign 5.0
items.summary:
- The DST completed its *Preparatory Phase* for **Special Campaign 5.0** by identifying pending VIP references, public grievances and parliamentary assurances.
- It planned digitization and *weeding of records* to free up office space, and mapped Swachhata sites across HQ and sub-offices.
- Targets were uploaded: 318 cleanliness sites, 6628 physical files, 1046 e-files, 88 pending grievances and 7 disposal appeals, with awareness campaigns planned for **Implementation Phase**.

items.title: DST Completes Preparatory Phase for Special Campaign 5.0
items.summary:
- DST completed the *preparatory phase* for **Special Campaign 5.0**, identifying 318 cleanliness sites, 6628 physical and 1046 e‑files, 88 grievances and 7 appeals.
- It assessed electronic/automobile/office scrap and planned *digitization* and record‑weeding to free office space across Headquarters, subordinate offices and autonomous bodies.
- Targets were uploaded to the campaign portal and *awareness* drives via PIB and social media are planned for the Implementation Phase (2–31 Oct 2025).

items.summary:
- **DST** organized an exhibition under **Swachhotsav** as part of **Swachhata Hi Sewa 2025**, including a pledge and Shramdaan at Vishwakarma Bhawan, Technology Bhawan and Vigyan Sadan. 
- On Sept 23–24, lectures on *Ayurveda for People and Planet* and *cervical cancer prevention* were delivered by Dr. D.C. Katoch and Dr. Seema Singhal. 
- On Sept 26, exhibitions on plasto-fuels from plastic waste, WEEE recycling, Rangoli, Clean Street Food, and a blood donation camp, inaugurated by **Prof. Abhay Karandikar**, showcased cleanliness and sustainable living.

Indian researchers develop nanomaterial to stimulate brain cells without surgery
items.summary:
*Scientists created a nanomaterial called g-C₃N₄ that can stimulate neurons without invasive procedures.*
- The material interacts naturally with brain cells, promoting growth, communication, and reducing disease-promoting proteins.
- This non-invasive approach could revolutionize treatment for neurodegenerative diseases like Parkinson’s and Alzheimer’s, as well as future bio-computing technologies.*

items.title: High-energy Rydberg study fuels next-gen quantum devices
items.summary:
- Researchers at Raman Research Institute cooled rubidium atoms to near absolute zero and excited them to *Rydberg states*, revealing *interaction-driven distortions* at very high energy levels. 
- Beyond the 100th energy level, atoms cease to behave as isolated particles and begin to *act collectively*, signaling a path toward **quantum computers**, **sensors**, and **communication devices**. 
- Led by *Prof. Sanjukta Roy* (RRI) with *Prof. Rejish Nath*’s team at *IISER Pune* providing theoretical modelling and a highly sensitive photon-detection system to map the boundary between isolated atoms and entangled networks.

items.title: Chiral perovskites for next-gen optoelectronics
items.summary:
- Chiral halide perovskite films crystallize from the air–film interface toward the substrate to yield phase-pure, *oriented* chiral films for *CPL detectors* and *spintronic* devices.
- Vacuum processing and careful *solvent choice* suppress residual-solvent–induced *1D impurities*, giving more uniform films.
- Tracking crystal growth over *two weeks* shows grains maturing into well‑organized structures, paving scalable routes for next‑gen optoelectronics.

items.title: DST to join Special Campaign 5.0 from Oct 2, 2025
items.summary:
- *DST* will participate in Special Campaign 5.0 starting on **2 October 2025**.
- Campaign 4.0 yielded 1057 grievances disposed, 8640 files weeded, 57959 sq ft freed, and Rs. 15,00,819/- scrap revenue.
- *DST* remains committed to building on these gains to achieve the objectives of **Special Campaign 5.0**.

items.title: Mapping the dusty veil of Milky Way
items.summary: - Astronomers mapped interstellar dust across the Milky Way using data from over 6,000 open clusters, revealing a thin, *reddening plane* that lies below the Galactic mid-plane.\n- The Sun sits about 50 light-years above this dusty layer, with dust density higher toward the Galactic center and a wave-like pattern changing with galactic longitude.\n- Future Gaia data releases and LSST will enable a fuller **3D view** of the dust, refining our understanding of star formation and Galactic structure.

items.title: Indian scientists develop flexible, safe battery
items.summary:
- Researchers developed a *water-based aluminum-ion battery* using a *CuHCFe cathode* and *MoO3 anode* that is *safe*, *flexible*, and cheaper, retaining ~96.77% of its capacity after 150 cycles.
- It stays functional when bent and even powers an LCD during extreme bending, signaling potential for *foldable smartphones*, wearable devices, and safer electric vehicles.
- Published in the *Journal of Energy Storage* (Elsevier) by CeNS (DST) and IISc CeNSE, this work positions India at the forefront of *sustainable energy storage*.

items.title: India and Netherlands strengthen ties to accelerate green hydrogen collaboration and innovation
items.summary:
- A stakeholder workshop linking the Netherlands' *hydrogen innovation mission* with India's *Hydrogen Valleys* aims to boost joint R&D and **industry–academia–government** collaboration for climate action.
- Ambassador Marisa Gerards praised India's energy-transition leadership and said **green hydrogen** is a pillar of the Netherlands' technology strategy, underscoring people-to-people ties, fellowships, and joint pilots.
- DST outlined India's 2030 targets and 2047 hydrogen hubs under a whole‑of‑government approach, and both sides reaffirmed commitment to accelerate the global energy transition through **innovation** and collaboration.

items.title: Eight Thiruvananthapuram Institutes Sign MoU
items.summary: - The eight premier national institutions in Thiruvananthapuram signed an *MoU* at SCTIMST to foster interdisciplinary academic and research collaboration.\n- They aim to promote *joint research*, student and faculty exchanges, and a *Young Researchers’ Platform* to nurture budding scientists.\n- The collaboration brings together RGCB, IISER, NCESS, CTCRI, CSIR-NIIST, IIST, C-DAC, and SCTIMST to deliver real-world solutions in health, tech, agriculture, and space.

items.title: Tug of war in gold nanoscale assembly boosts biosensors
items.summary:
- *GdnHCl* drives rapid aggregation of gold nanoparticles, but adding *L-Trp* yields looser networks via *frustrated aggregation*. 
- Using the ultra-sensitive *EW-CRDS* technique, the researchers monitor surface assembly in real time, revealing slower aggregation and a new open structure. 
- Published in *Analytical Chemistry*, the work points to smarter biosensors and more reliable diagnostics through precise control of nanoparticle assembly.

items.title: Two new Aspergillus species from Western Ghats
items.author: Harikrishnan K., Rajesh Kumar K. C., Ravindra M. Patil
items.summary:
- Indian researchers from MACS-ARI Pune describe two novel species, *Aspergillus dhakephalkarii* and *Aspergillus patriciawiltshireae*, from the Western Ghats, with first Indian records of *A. aculeatinus* and *A. brunneoviolaceus*. 
- They used a polyphasic taxonomy approach, combining detailed morphology with multi-gene phylogeny (ITS, CaM, BenA, RPB2) and maximum likelihood analyses to delineate the new lineages. 
- This work highlights the Western Ghats as a fungal diversity hotspot and marks the first Indian integrative taxonomy study on Aspergillus section Nigri, published in Phytotaxa (2025).

items.title: Nagaland fossils link Antarctica to Indian monsoons
items.summary:
- The study links **Antarctic ice growth (~34 Ma)** to the early Indian monsoon by shifting the *ITCZ*, as shown by Nagaland fossil leaves.
- Using CLAMP analysis, researchers found Nagaland's climate was *warmer and wetter* than today, matching global timing of Antarctic glaciation.
- The work warns that **future Antarctic melt** could move the ITCZ and disrupt the monsoon, affecting agriculture and water in India and neighbors.

items.title: Cholesterol could power tomorrow's electronics
items.summary:
- Cholesterol-based nanomaterials can control electron *spin*, enabling energy-efficient spintronic devices.
- By pairing cholesterol with metal ions, the team tunes spin filtering within a single system for versatile *spin* control.
- Researchers at INST Mohali suggest potential for energy-efficient memory chips and bioelectronic devices via cholesterol platforms, advancing **quantum technologies**.

Dust grains align with Galaxy magnetic field - new evidence
items.summary:
- New observations with the POL-2 polarimeter on the James Clerk Maxwell Telescope reveal the strongest evidence that *non-spherical dust grains* align with the Milky Way's *magnetic fields*, studied in the *G34.43+0.24* cloud.
- The analysis identifies three alignment mechanisms—*RAT-A*, *RAT-D*, and *M-RAT*—showing grains can align, disrupt, or align more efficiently under radiation and magnetic conditions.
- The results advance mapping of *Galactic magnetic fields* and deepen understanding of star formation and galactic structure, reaffirming longstanding *grain-alignment theories*.

items.title: Invisible bacteria in city air threaten health
items.summary:
*Airborne pathogenic bacteria are twice as prevalent in densely populated areas like Delhi.*
- These bacteria, linked to respiratory and other infections, hitch rides on *PM<sub>2.5</sub>* particles, which penetrate deep into the lungs.
- Seasonal, meteorological, and pollution factors influence bacterial spread, creating high-risk windows for disease transmission, especially during winter and hazy days.

**Keywords:** air pollution, bacteria, Delhi, PM2.5, public health, meteorology

items.title: A tiny Computer's big role in unveiling the Universe's earliest whispers
items.summary:
*A compact single-board computer (SBC) is pivotal in a new radiometer mission called PRATUSH, aimed at exploring the *Cosmic Dawn*.*
- PRATUSH, set for lunar orbit, seeks faint radio signals from hydrogen atoms to understand the universe's first stars.
- Utilizing a Raspberry Pi-based digital receiver, the system demonstrates high sensitivity and low noise, crucial for detecting signals buried under interference.*

items.title: New compound can combat aggressive breast cancer
items.summary:
- Researchers synthesized a novel *organoselenium compound* that reduces the *invasiveness* of *triple-negative breast cancer cells*.
- The compound, called *diselenide 7*, *targets multiple signaling pathways* like Akt/mTOR and ERK, and induces *reactive oxygen species* (ROS), leading to cancer cell death.
- Studies in mice showed *decreased tumor growth*, *less metastasis*, and *extended lifespan*, supporting its potential as a *multitargeting anticancer agent*.

items.title: Tiny Gold Particles for Early Parkinson's Detection
items.summary:
*Researchers developed a biosensor using *gold nanoclusters* to detect *Parkinson’s Disease* (PD) early.*
- The sensor distinguishes between normal and toxic forms of the PD-related protein *α-synuclein* by sensing surface charge.
- This innovative, *cost-effective* tool could enable early diagnosis, improving treatment outcomes and potentially detecting other neurodegenerative diseases, advancing *precision medicine*.*

items.title: Giant antibody acts as a brace against bacterial toxins
items.summary:
*Scientists discovered that the large antibody IgM not only binds to pathogens but also mechanically stabilizes bacterial toxins, preventing damage.*
*Using single-molecule force spectroscopy, IgM acts like a *brace*, increasing the resistance of proteins like Protein L to mechanical stress.*
*This finding suggests new therapeutic avenues by designing antibodies that mechanically disable bacterial virulence factors.*

items.title: A new window into the stars by modeling stellar atmosphere
items.summary:
- *Researchers have advanced* computational models to simulate *stellar atmospheres* more realistically, capturing their chaotic nature.
- The new *FNLTE approach* solves complex equations, revealing significant *deviations* from traditional models, especially near star surfaces.
- This breakthrough enables *more accurate* interpretation of stellar spectra, aiding in the study of *star properties, circumstellar disks,* and the search for *Earth-like exoplanets*.

items.title: Smart Materials for Energy-Efficient Windows
items.summary:
*Scientists develop *smart windows* using Polymer Network Liquid Crystals (PNLCs) with tiny *hexagonal boron nitride (h-BN) flakes*.
- These nanomaterials *enhance infrared (IR) light scattering*, reducing heat entry and lowering air conditioning load.
- Scaled-up versions could enable *energy-efficient heat management*, significantly impacting *building cooling technologies*.

**Keywords:** smart windows, nanomaterials, energy saving, infrared control, polymer liquid crystals

items.title: Air and ingenious nozzles could transform coatings for high temperature tolerance
items.summary:
• ARCI's innovative use of *air* as a process gas enables *cost-effective cold spray* coatings. 
• Custom-designed *nozzles* improve *coating effectiveness* at lower pressures, reducing energy usage. 
• Dense Ni–Cr coatings offer *superior oxidation resistance* and thermal stability for *high-temperature industrial applications*.

items.title: Innovative sensor detects hazardous gases like hydrogen and NO2
items.summary:
*A low-power, miniaturized sensor can detect trace **hydrogen** leaks and **toxicity** of nitrogen dioxide at room temperature.*

*Researchers developed nanostructured sensors using NiO and ZnO materials, offering a **scalable** and **cost-effective** solution for safety and environmental monitoring.*

*This breakthrough enables **real-time leak detection** in fuel stations, industry, and urban areas, supporting **India's green energy** goals and IoT applications.*
